timeline.bodyText: you seem to be removing our integration tests. are the tests not working for v3?
timeline.author: moderakh
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -55,71 +54,6 @@ jobs:
 
       TestResultsFiles: '**/junitreports/TEST-*.xml'
 
-
-  # This template parllelizes tests that could be run on Single_Region_Session
-  # by running them against a different cosmosdb instance
-  - template: ../../eng/pipelines/templates/jobs/archetype-sdk-tests.yml
-    parameters:
-      TestName: Single_Region_Session_2

replies.bodyText:
They are:

just clubbed some of different CIs to single CI with both Https and Tcp protocol.
removed some of the extra ones which we don't need every single time for every change.
In addition, we really don't need all these CIs for v3 as there is no feature changes going on.

I am okay with adding them back if you think they are essential.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.bodyText: why these ones are removed? is that intentional?
timeline.author: moderakh
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -22,7 +22,6 @@ jobs:
           DisplayName: ReadMyWrites Integration Tests
           OSVmImage: 'ubuntu-18.04'
           ProfileFlag: '-Pe2e'
-          AdditionalArgs: '-DargLine="-Dcosmos.directModeProtocol=Https"'

replies.bodyText: Yes, currently on V3-  we are not running e2e tests on Tcp mode, which is important as compared to running e2e tests on https mode.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.author: moderakh
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -190,7 +189,6 @@ jobs:
           DisplayName: Single Region ReadMyWrites
           OSVmImage: 'ubuntu-18.04'
           ProfileFlag: '-Pe2e'
-          AdditionalArgs: '-DargLine="-Dcosmos.directModeProtocol=Https"'

replies.bodyText: Yes, currently on V3- we are not running e2e tests on Tcp mode, which is important as compared to running e2e tests on https mode.
replies.author: kushagraThapar
